intro: Liabum sericolepis, commonly known as the silky leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
